overview: From 2025-10-27 to 2025-10-28, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 16 new PRs (9 merged), 4 new issues, and 33 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-deployer: more end-to-end testing
topIssues.author: bitwiseguy
topIssues.body:
To prevent bugs from entering op-deployer, we should implement more end-to-end tests that check full user flows.

-  [ ] upgrading contracts versions (v1.8.0 -> v4.0.0): test in anvil env
-  [ ] verify contracts: difficult to run in ci against external services (block explorers) but we should be able to add tests that confirm forge artifacts exist for each contract, and that constructor args for OpChain contracts can be extracted from state.json for verification requests

topIssues.title: feat(tests): Preconfigure dashboards for sysgo metrics
topIssues.author: op-will
topIssues.body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
-->
[This PR](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18017) adds observability to sysgo, but it does not add any dashboards that are preconfigured along with the grafana instance. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
-->
Any relevant dashboards should be preconfigured within the grafana instance so that they are available by default.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
<!--
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-->
N/A

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
-->

See Kurtosis [config](https://github.com/ethpandaops/optimism-package/blob/7bef190d7c0b9f619438ed08b17bd5e5f51e72ff/README.md?plain=1#L130-L135) for some applicable dashboards and possible config structure.

topIssues.title: op-deployer: migrate to DeployPreimageOracle2.s.sol
topIssues.author: bitwiseguy
topIssues.body: To complete the strangler fig strategy, we need to remove the legacy DeployPreimageOracle.s.sol script and fully lean on the new DeployPreimageOracle2.s.sol format. See [this pr](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/18002) for an example of the end state we want to be in.

topPRs.title: Standard versions generation script
topPRs.author: maurelian

topPRs.title: op-deployer: Support working with V2 fault dispute game contracts
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Finish updating op-deployer to work with V2 fault dispute game contracts.

* Deploying implementations supports the fault dispute game configuration options previously used by deploy dispute game
* DeployDisputeGame has been updated to work with v1 and v2 contracts
* SetDisputeGameImpl works with and without game args
* ReadImplementationAddresses loads the V2 dispute game addresses

**Tests**

Existing tests continue working. Made a number of tests run with both v1 and v2 contracts.

topPRs.title: op-deployer: remove legacy DeployDisputeGame.s.sol
topPRs.author: bitwiseguy
topPRs.body:
op-deployer used the "strangler fig" (aka "dangling twig") strategy to refactor DeployDisputeGame.s.sol into a new, more intuitive, less verbose format with input/output structs instead of writing input/output values to contract storage. We had a test in place to ensure equivalence between the two formats of that script.

This pr completes the migrations to the new format for that script by:
1. Removing legacy DeployDisputeGame.s.sol
2. Renaming DeployDisputeGame2.s.sol to DeployDisputeGame.s.sol
3. Updating related op-deployer code to use the new DeployDisputeGame.s.sol

In order to get op-e2e tests to pass, I had to remove the following input assertions from the new script:
1. `input.clockDuration != 0`
2. `input.maxClockDuration != 0`
3. `input.proposer == address(0)` for FaultDisputeGame
4. `input.challenger == address(0)` for FaultDisputeGame

If those are all valid assertions we want to make, we'd have to update op-e2e tests to pass different inputs.

topPRs.title: op-acceptance-tests: add test to base gate for unsafe gossip / head progression
topPRs.author: geoknee
topPRs.body:
We recently realised that acceptance tests do not give us good coverage for unsafe head progression via p2p gossip. See, for example, https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17940 (a bug which wasn't caught by ATs) as well as a recent op-reth bug we only caught on devnet. 

This test adds that coverage, and simply asserts that a) there are some non-sequencer verifier nodes and b) they catch up to the sequencer within a timeout period. 

The test disables the sysgo batcher, because otherwise safe chain derivation would allow the test to pass even if gossip was broken. Therefore this test should not run against external networks. 

I confirmed manually that introducing a bug, where op-node just rejects gossip payloads unconditionally, does indeed cause this test to fail.
